main.name: Ahmad
main.description: ; I am currently a SWE for Duke OIT, developing a web application allowing students to request or donate their food points. I'm currently also working alongside Duke Men's Basketball to develop a web & mobile shift scheduling application. You can read more about these applications and my other works
main.bio: Hello! I'm an undergraduate at Duke University studying Computer Science. I am fascinated by all kinds of technology, especially software! I will take any and every opportunity that I can to learn, be it reading car manuals cover to cover or watching tech product reviews. In my free time I love going on bike rides, window shopping for shoes and building computers. My goal as a software engineer is to produce performant and responsive products but more importantly, work towards becoming a better developer and team member every day.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me using the form below:

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of the skills that I am proficient in:

education.description: President of Game Tenting Help Center, Member of Duke Applied Machine Learning, Muslim Student Association, Alpha Phi Omega, Questbridge Scholar, Summit United Mentor

work.company: Food Point Donation Program: Feed Every Devil
work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Remote internship focused on Development of web application using Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, and Transact API allowing students to donate food points to food insecure peers. Responsible for authoring onboarding documentation & style guide for incoming members, developing responsive webpages, implementing Ruby backend for admin interface that reviews and approves requests for food points. Trained team to use Git and led daily standups to delegate tasks and guide application design decisions

work.title: President
work.description: Responsible for team recruiting/onboarding, application infrastructure decisions, task delegation among SW teams and assisting members with programming tasks as needed

work.title: IT Technician
work.description: Responsible for troubleshooting Windows and Apple products for Duke Medical students, as well as overseeing Duke Medical students' devices using Jamf and Airwatch to ensure security compliance

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
